casebody.data:
PEOPLE v. LUCAS et al. (Common Pleas of New York City and County, General Term. May 17, 1894.) Motion by George Lucas, principal, and Charles Lighte, surety, to vacate-judgment entered on a forfeited recognizance. •

Argued before BOOKSTAVER, BISCHOFF, and PRYOR, JJ.

John R. Fellows, for the People. F. P. Trautman, for defendants.

No opinion. Motion granted.
